intro: Palicourea chrysotricha, commonly known as golden-haired palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or yellow in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, textured surface. Palicourea chrysotricha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
